refnamediv.refpurpose: shrink a black and white bw file

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Bwshrink will take a black and white bw5 format file of given dimensions and produce a smaller scaled version. The -w and -n flags specify the input file width and number of scan lines in pixels. They can both be set to the same value via -s. Defaults of 512 are assumed for unspecified dimensions. The integer scaling factor is set with the -f flag. By default, the factor is 2.
The program reads the entire image into memory, and then scales the image down to 1/factor the original size in both dimensions.
By default, bwshrink uses boxcar averaging to produce the output pixels from the input. The -u option causes bwshrink to use image undersampling instead.

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: If the dimensions of the input image are not evenly divisible by the shrink factor, incorrect and bizarre output is generated.
